page.title: 18EYEMOUTH HERRING QUEEN
page.content: Each July a Herring Queen and Court of 6 are chosen from girls at the local Secondary School.At one time they all had to be the daughters of local fishermen but this no longer applies. The week long Festival which marks the towns one time importance as a herring port,opens with the Queen and Court being brought by fishing boat from the nearby port of St Abbs.Once ashore the Queen is crowned by the retiring Queen and after various welcoming speeches she presents awards and prizes.Later at the head of a convoy of cars and floats she tours Eyemouth. Foe the rest of the week she attends various civic functions,including parades,dances and football matches, making welcoming speeches and handing our awards.
